movies.title: The Pitch o' Chance
movies.plot: Rocky bets on "everything, anything and nothing at all". On one occasion he wins a high bet including the saloon bully's gal, thanks to a cheat played by a girl competitor who wants the man for herself. When the bully finds out he believes Rocky has fooled him and goes furiously after him.
movies.simplePlot: Rocky bets on "everything, anything and nothing at all". On one occasion he wins a high bet including the saloon bully's gal, thanks to a cheat played by a girl competitor who wants the man...

biography.bio: Frank Borzage was born on April 23, 1894 in Salt Lake City, Utah, USA. He was an actor and director, known for A Farewell to Arms (1932), 7th Heaven (1927) and Stage Door Canteen (1943). He was married to Juanita Scott, Edna Skelton and Rena Rogers. He died on June 19, 1962 in Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Frank Borzage

biography.bio: Helene Rosson was born on June 14, 1897 in Newport, Rhode Island, USA as Helene Margaret Rosson. She was an actress, known for The Mighty Hold (1915), April (1916) and The Light (1916). She was married to Ashton Dearholt. She died on May 5, 1985 in Palm Beach, Florida, USA.
biography.name: Helene Rosson

biography.placeOfBirth: New York City, New York, USA
biography.bio: Jack Richardson was born on November 18, 1870 in New York City, New York, USA as John Howard Richardson. He was an actor, known for The Crimson Clue (1922), Trial Marriage (1928) and The Man Above the Law (1918). He was married to Louise Lester and Florence Stone. He died on June 12, 1960 in Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Jack Richardson

biography.bio: Lizette Thorne was born on November 24, 1882 in Birmingham, England. She was an actress, known for In the Sunset Country (1915), The Key (1916) and The Dreamer (1916). She died on November 3, 1970 in Los Angeles, California, USA.
biography.name: Lizette Thorne
